title: Ticket #7796: Add DAGMan -dot flag, to only write a .dot file without running jobs
description:
We want to give condor_dagman the ability to output a .dot file visualization of a DAG graph, without actually processing the jobs in the graph.

To start, we'll update condor_dagman to take a -dot command-line argument. When it sees this argument, it will parse the .dag file, output a .dot file as specified, and then exit immediately without running any of the jobs.

Next, we'll update condor_submit_dag to take a -dot command-line argument which it will then pass on to condor_dagman. The reason for this step is because there is no simple way to run condor_dagman directly from the command line; it is designed to only work in the context of a .condor.sub file generated by condor_submit_dag.
